metadata.source_description: 2022 San Francisco Building Inspection Commission Codes (Building, Fire, etc.)
metadata.notes: All 47 Administrative Bulletins printed in the 2022 SF Building Code. Line numbers are 1-indexed.

administrative_bulletins.title: Preparing Administrative Bulletins
administrative_bulletins.subject: General Administrative Procedures

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Internal DBI procedure for creating ABs. Not relevant to permit routing or requirements.

administrative_bulletins.title: Priority Permit Processing Guidelines
administrative_bulletins.subject: Permit Processing and Issuance

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Defines which permits qualify for priority processing (emergency, disabled access, clean energy, seismic, affordable housing, ADU/JADU, historic, NOV compliance). Critical for routing and timeline estimates.

administrative_bulletins.title: Procedures for Approval of Local Equivalencies
administrative_bulletins.subject: Plan Review and Permit Process

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Master procedure for all local equivalency requests. When code compliance is impractical, this AB governs the alternate approval path. Referenced by AB-009, AB-010, AB-018, AB-019, AB-020, AB-057.

administrative_bulletins.title: Local Equivalency for Approval of New Openings in New and Existing Building Property Line Walls
administrative_bulletins.subject: Fire and Life Safety

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Applies when projects propose property-line wall openings. Triggers local equivalency review, fire sprinkler requirements, and Declaration of Use Limitation recording.

administrative_bulletins.title: Local Equivalency for Approval of Communicating Openings Between Buildings on Separate Properties
administrative_bulletins.subject: Fire and Life Safety

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Applies when projects connect buildings across property lines. Triggers fire assembly, sprinkler, and structural review requirements plus Declaration of Use Limitation.

administrative_bulletins.title: Application of Disabled Access Provisions to Historic Buildings
administrative_bulletins.subject: Disabled Access

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Governs when historic buildings can use State Historical Building Code alternatives for disabled access. Key routing decision: is building historic AND does work affect access? Routes to Access Appeals Commission if needed.

administrative_bulletins.title: Allowable Temporary Interruptions to Disabled Access
administrative_bulletins.subject: Disabled Access

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Narrow scope: addresses temporary interruptions like fire door hold-opens during testing. Not a major permit routing factor.

administrative_bulletins.title: Exception to Requirements for Disabled Access to Vacant Spaces
administrative_bulletins.subject: Disabled Access

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Relevant for vacant building reoccupancy: access features not required until space is reoccupied, but permit required before reoccupancy to correct violations. Affects enforcement routing.

administrative_bulletins.title: Local Equivalency for Approval of Emergency Escape or Rescue Windows at Courts and Light Wells
administrative_bulletins.subject: Fire and Life Safety

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Applies to residential projects with emergency escape windows opening into courts/lightwells. Requires sprinklers, fire-rated roof, and alternate egress path. Common in dense SF building stock.

administrative_bulletins.title: Local Equivalency for Approval of Fire Escapes as a Required Means of Egress
administrative_bulletins.subject: Fire and Life Safety

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Critical for existing building renovations. Fire escapes are extremely common in older SF buildings. This AB defines when they can serve as required egress, with detailed construction/rating requirements. Frequently triggered in alteration permits.

administrative_bulletins.title: Local Equivalency for Exiting Through a Garage Area for Type V, Group R Buildings
administrative_bulletins.subject: Fire and Life Safety

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Common in SF residential: exiting through garage in wood-frame buildings. Triggers fire separation, sprinkler, and CO detection requirements.

administrative_bulletins.title: Crane Site Safety Plan and Building Permits
administrative_bulletins.subject: Plan Review; Permit Process

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Required for any project using tower cranes. Triggers separate crane permit and safety plan review. Relevant for large new construction and major alteration projects.

administrative_bulletins.title: Preapplication Requirement for State Industrial Safety Permit for Certain Trenching, Demolition, and Construction Activities
administrative_bulletins.subject: Permit Process; Inspection

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Requires Cal/OSHA Industrial Safety Permit BEFORE DBI permit issuance for trenching, demolition, and certain construction. Key pre-application routing requirement.

administrative_bulletins.title: Noise Insulation Enforcement Procedures
administrative_bulletins.subject: Plan Check; Inspection

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Applies to new residential construction near freeways, airports, and high-noise areas. Triggers acoustic testing requirements and special inspection.

administrative_bulletins.title: Illegal Unit Reoccupancy Enforcement Procedure
administrative_bulletins.subject: Code Enforcement

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Relevant for repeat violations of illegal unit reoccupancy. Affects enforcement escalation routing and penalty procedures.

administrative_bulletins.title: Pre-application and Pre-addendum Plan Review Procedures
administrative_bulletins.subject: General Administrative Procedures

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Establishes pre-application meeting procedures. Critical routing decision: complex projects should be routed through pre-app review before formal submittal. Referenced by many other ABs.

administrative_bulletins.title: Identification of Revisions on Pages of Drawings
administrative_bulletins.subject: Plan Review

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Submittal formatting requirement for revised drawings. Not a routing decision but affects plan review completeness checks.

administrative_bulletins.title: Site Permit Processing
administrative_bulletins.subject: Permit Process

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Defines site permit process allowing construction to begin before all plans are complete. Critical for large projects. Establishes phased permit issuance (site permit + addenda). Major routing pathway for new construction.

administrative_bulletins.title: Procedure for Assigning Street Numbers (Addresses)
administrative_bulletins.subject: General Administrative Procedures

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Required for new buildings, subdivisions, and projects creating new tenant spaces. Triggers address assignment process which affects permit issuance sequencing.

administrative_bulletins.title: Special Inspection for Demolition Work
administrative_bulletins.subject: Inspection

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Requires special inspector for demolition of Type I-IV buildings over 2 stories/25 feet. Key routing trigger for demolition permits: determines if special inspection is required.

administrative_bulletins.title: Referral of Design Professionals and Contractors to Regulatory Agencies
administrative_bulletins.subject: General Administrative Procedures

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Internal DBI procedure for referring professionals to State License Boards. Not directly relevant to permit routing.

administrative_bulletins.title: Board of Examiners: Request for Variance, New Materials, or Alternate Methods of Construction
administrative_bulletins.subject: Plan Review; Permit Process

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Defines when and how to route projects to the Board of Examiners for variances, new materials, or alternate construction methods. Key escalation path when standard code compliance is not feasible.

administrative_bulletins.title: Ventilation of Public Spaces in Group R Occupancies
administrative_bulletins.subject: Plan Review; Permit Process

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Provides ventilation guidelines for residential building common areas (lobbies, corridors, laundry rooms). Affects mechanical plan review requirements for Group R occupancy permits.

administrative_bulletins.title: Special Inspection and Structural Observation Documentation Procedures
administrative_bulletins.subject: Permit Process; Inspection

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Comprehensive procedures for special inspection and structural observation. Defines when special inspections are required, documentation requirements, and inspector qualifications. Affects nearly all structural permits.

administrative_bulletins.title: Specific Submittal Criteria for Reports, Special Inspections and Final Acceptance Testing of Smoke Control Systems
administrative_bulletins.subject: Smoke Control Systems

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Longest AB. Detailed requirements for smoke control system design, submittal, testing, and acceptance. Required for high-rises, atriums, underground structures, and smoke-proof enclosures. Major routing trigger for fire/life safety review.

administrative_bulletins.title: Disabled Access Compliance Status Documentation
administrative_bulletins.subject: Disabled Access

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Establishes procedure for documenting building accessibility compliance status. Creates CASp-like documentation pathway. Affects all commercial and public building permits regarding access compliance verification.

administrative_bulletins.title: Local Equivalency for Approval of Roof Hatches in Lieu of Stairway Penthouses in Designated Buildings
administrative_bulletins.subject: Plan Review and Permit Process

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Allows roof hatches instead of stairway penthouses in certain buildings. Relevant for rooftop access in existing buildings where penthouse construction is impractical.

administrative_bulletins.title: Procedures for Seismic Instrumentation of New Buildings
administrative_bulletins.subject: Building Seismic Instrumentation

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Required for new buildings meeting size/height thresholds. Triggers seismic instrumentation installation and monitoring requirements.

administrative_bulletins.title: Criteria for Waiving Special Inspection Requirements for Signs, Awnings and Canopies
administrative_bulletins.subject: Permit Review and Operation

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Defines when special inspection can be waived for sign/awning/canopy permits. Key for OTC vs. plan-review routing of sign permits.

administrative_bulletins.title: Guidelines and Procedures for Structural, Geotechnical, and Seismic Hazard Engineering Design Review
administrative_bulletins.subject: Permit Processing and Issuance

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Comprehensive structural design review requirements. Defines when independent structural peer review is required, geotechnical report requirements, and seismic hazard review criteria. Major routing trigger for large/complex structural projects.

administrative_bulletins.title: Requirements and Guidelines for the Seismic Design of New Tall Buildings using Non-Prescriptive Seismic-Design Procedures
administrative_bulletins.subject: Permit Processing and Issuance

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Governs performance-based seismic design for tall buildings (240+ feet). Requires seismic peer review panel, detailed analysis procedures, and special reporting. Critical routing trigger for any tall building project.

administrative_bulletins.title: Guidelines for the Structural Review of Continuous Tiedown Systems Used to Resist Overturning of Light-Framed Wood Shear Walls
administrative_bulletins.subject: Plan Check; Inspection

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Technical structural review criteria for wood-frame buildings with continuous tiedown systems. Affects structural plan review for multi-story wood-frame construction.

administrative_bulletins.title: Collection and Storage of Recyclable, Compostable and Trash Materials
administrative_bulletins.subject: Resource Conservation

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Implements California recycling access requirements. Affects building design for trash/recycling/composting areas. Required for all new construction and major renovations.

administrative_bulletins.title: Implementation of Green Building Regulations
administrative_bulletins.subject: Administration and General Design

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Master green building implementation AB. Defines SF Green Building Code requirements for new construction, additions, and alterations by project size/type. Determines green building documentation, commissioning, and certification requirements. Major routing factor.

administrative_bulletins.title: Definition and Design Criteria for Voluntary Seismic Upgrade of Soft-Story, Type V (Wood-Frame) Buildings
administrative_bulletins.subject: Permit Review and Operation

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Defines criteria for voluntary soft-story seismic upgrades (precursor to mandatory program). Establishes what qualifies as soft-story and acceptable retrofit designs. Routes to priority processing per AB-004.

administrative_bulletins.title: Post-Earthquake Repair and Retrofit Requirements for Wood-Frame Residential Buildings with Three or More Dwelling Units
administrative_bulletins.subject: Permit Review and Operations

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Post-earthquake retrofit triggers for wood-frame residential (3+ units). Defines damage thresholds that trigger mandatory seismic retrofit. Critical for post-disaster permit routing.

administrative_bulletins.title: Post-Earthquake Repair and Retrofit Requirements for Concrete Buildings
administrative_bulletins.subject: Permit Review and Operations

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Post-earthquake retrofit triggers for pre-1973 concrete buildings. Defines damage assessment, retrofit scope, and engineering criteria. Critical for post-disaster permit routing of concrete structures.

administrative_bulletins.title: Post-Earthquake Repair and Retrofit Requirements for One- and Two-Family Units
administrative_bulletins.subject: Permit Review and Operation

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Post-earthquake retrofit triggers for 1-2 family wood-frame dwellings. Companion to AB-098 for smaller residential. Critical for post-disaster permit routing.

administrative_bulletins.title: Voluntary Sprinkler Protection for Existing High-Rise Buildings
administrative_bulletins.subject: Administrative Permit, Fire and Life Safety

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Procedure for documenting voluntary sprinkler installation in pre-requirement high-rises. Affects permit tracking and fire safety documentation for existing high-rise alterations.

administrative_bulletins.title: Procedures for Implementation of SFEBC Chapter 5E
administrative_bulletins.subject: Seismic Strengthening of Soft Story Wood Frame Buildings

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Implements the MANDATORY soft-story retrofit program (Chapter 5E). Defines compliance tiers, timelines, screening criteria, and permit procedures. Critical routing trigger: any soft-story building on the city's list MUST comply.

administrative_bulletins.title: Application of Engineering Criteria in SFEBC Chapter 5E
administrative_bulletins.subject: Seismic Strengthening of Soft Story Wood Frame Buildings

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Companion to AB-106. Provides detailed engineering criteria for mandatory soft-story retrofits. The longest technical AB. Defines structural analysis methods, design standards, and plan check requirements for Chapter 5E compliance.

administrative_bulletins.title: Application of California Existing Building Code, Appendix Chapter A3
administrative_bulletins.subject: Permit Processing and Issuance

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Implements CEBC Appendix A3 for prescriptive seismic strengthening of cripple walls and sill plates in light wood-frame residential. Common retrofit scope for older single-family homes.

administrative_bulletins.title: Application of Engineering Criteria in SFEBC Section 329
administrative_bulletins.subject: Seismic Evaluation of Private School Facilities

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Mandatory seismic evaluation program for private schools (Section 329). Defines evaluation criteria and reporting standards. Routes to priority processing per AB-004.

administrative_bulletins.title: Building Facade Inspection and Maintenance
administrative_bulletins.subject: Permit Review and Operations

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Implements SFEBC Chapter 5F facade inspection requirements. Defines inspection cycles, reporting, and repair permit requirements for buildings 6+ stories. Creates ongoing permit obligations for building owners.

administrative_bulletins.title: Guidelines for Preparation of Geotechnical and Earthquake Ground Motion Reports for Foundation Design and Construction of Tall Buildings
administrative_bulletins.subject: Permit Processing and Issuance

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Detailed geotechnical and ground motion report requirements for tall buildings. Companion to AB-082 and AB-083. Defines required geotechnical investigations, seismic hazard analysis, and foundation design criteria. Critical for tall building permit routing.

administrative_bulletins.title: Implementation of All Electric New Construction Regulations
administrative_bulletins.subject: Administration and General Design

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Implements SF's all-electric new construction mandate. Defines which projects must be all-electric, exemptions, and compliance pathways. Major routing factor for all new construction permits since June 2021.

administrative_bulletins.title: Application of Engineering Criteria in SFEBC Appendix A, Chapter A6
administrative_bulletins.subject: Seismic Retrofit Provisions for Concrete Buildings

relevance_to_decision_tree.explanation: Newest AB (2025). Provides engineering criteria for SFEBC Chapter A6 concrete building seismic retrofits. Companion to Chapter 5G mandatory concrete building program. Defines deficiency evaluation, retrofit triggers, and engineering options.

high: AB-005 - Procedures for Approval of Local Equivalencies
AB-013 - Disabled Access for Historic Buildings
AB-019 - Fire Escapes as Required Egress
AB-111 - Geotechnical Reports for Tall Buildings
AB-113 - Concrete Building Seismic Retrofit (Chapter A6)
medium: AB-017 - Disabled Access for Vacant Spaces
AB-057 - Roof Hatches vs Stairway Penthouses
AB-078 - Waiving Special Inspection for Signs
low: AB-015 - Temporary Interruptions to Disabled Access

critical_for_permit_routing: AB-004 - Determines priority processing eligibility (emergency, ADA, clean energy, seismic, housing, ADU, historic, NOV)
AB-005 - Master local equivalency procedure; gateway to all equivalency ABs
AB-028 - Pre-application review routing for complex projects
AB-032 - Site permit pathway for phased large projects
AB-036 - Special inspection trigger for demolition permits
AB-042 - Board of Examiners escalation path for variances
AB-046 - Special inspection requirements affecting all structural permits
AB-047 - Smoke control requirements for high-rises, atriums, underground
AB-082 - Structural peer review triggers for complex projects
AB-083 - Tall building (240+ ft) performance-based seismic design pathway
AB-093 - Green building compliance pathway by project type/size
AB-106 - Mandatory soft-story retrofit compliance and timelines
AB-110 - Facade inspection obligations for 6+ story buildings
AB-112 - All-electric mandate for new construction since June 2021
AB-113 - Mandatory concrete building seismic program (Chapter 5G/A6)
